news.title: IPO Shares of Crest Micro Life Insurance Listed in Nepse
news.summary: Investopaper Nepal Stock Exchange has listed the IPO shares of Crest Micro Life Insurance Limited. As
news.full_content:
Nepal Stock Exchange has listed the IPO shares of Crest Micro Life Insurance Limited.

As per the information, 75,00,000 units IPO shares of Crest Micro Life InsuranceLimited (CREST) has been listed in NEPSE. The open price range is set as Rs. 100.86 to Rs. 302.58 for the first transactions.

Crest Micro Life Insurance had floated shares to the general public from Falgun 22, 2081 BS to Falgun 26, 2081 BS.

After the listing, investors can trade their shares in the market. The trading of shares of CREST will start from Today.

news.title: IPO Allotment of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Concluded [IPO Result !!]
news.summary: Investopaper IPO Allotment Of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited NIMB Ace Capital Limited, the issue manager for
news.full_content:
NIMB Ace Capital Limited, the issue manager for the initial public offering (IPO) of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited, has concluded the IPO allotment process on Tuesday.

After the allotment, 1,84,500 applicants received 10 shares each through lottery. A total of 19,55,685 valid applicants had subscribed for the shares. About 17.71 lakh applicants were left empty-handed.

To view the IPO result of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited, click the link below:

IPO Result Of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited

After the first phase, Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited had issued the shares to the general public in the second phase of an initial public offering (IPO) from Falgun 22, 2081 BS.

The company had sold 18,45,000 shares at Rs. 100 per share to the general public.

Due to over-subscription of shares, the second phase of the IPO was closed on Falgun 26, 2081 BS.

Interested investors could apply for a minimum of 10 shares and a maximum of 10,000 shares.

The company allotted 1,12,500 shares to the mutual fund schemes and has reserved 67,500 shares to the employees.

In the first phase of the IPO, Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited had floated 2,25,000 shares (10 percent of general public’s quota) to the foreign employed Nepalis from Magh 15, 2081 BS. The first phase of the IPO was closed on Magh 29, 2081 BS.

Interested Nepalis in foreign employment could apply for a minimum of 10 shares and a maximum of 10,000 shares.

In total, the company has plans to sell 22,50,000 unit shares in the public offering (including the first and the second phase). At a par value of Rs 100, the public issue amounts to Rs 22.50 crores.

Securities Board Of Nepal (SEBON) gave the approval to the company on Magh 3, 2081 BS regarding the public issuance.

NIMB Ace Capital Limited is the issue and sales manager for the IPO.The agreement was signed by Mr. Sibanta Bahadur Pande, Chief Executive Officer of NIMB Ace Capital and Mr. Pratap Man Shrestha, Chief Executive Officer of Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited.

Crest Micro-Life Insurance Limited, incorporated on Jestha 14, 2080 BS as a public limited company, has a license from Nepal Insurance Authority to operate micro-life insurance business in Nepal.

As of Ashad’s end 2081 BS, the major promoters of the company include:

—Himalayan Reinsurance Limited (21.43% share),

—Metro Capital Pvt. Ltd. (16.62% share),

—Kishan Lal Dugar (6.67% share),

—K.R.S Investment Pvt. Ltd. (6.67% share),

—Sangeeta Devi More (3.97% share),

—Anupam Rathi (3.33% share) and others

news.title: List of Insurance Companies In Nepal [Updated]
news.summary: Investopaper As of Shrawan’s end, 2080 BS, there are 34 insurance companies operating in Nepal. The
news.full_content:
As of Shrawan’s end, 2080 BS, there are 34 insurance companies operating in Nepal. The insurance companies in Nepal are divided into 4 types:

1. Life Insurance

2. Non-Life of General Insurance

3. Reinsurance

4. Microinsurance

Among the 34 insurance companies, 14 are life insurance, 14 are non-life or general insurance, 2 are reinsurance companies and 4 are microinsurance companies.

Life insurance is a contractual transaction in which a person pays a certain amount in installments based on the age of the person and in the event of his death his heirs receive a certain amount.

There are currently 14 life insurance companies in Nepal. The list of the life insurance companies is shown below:

1. Rastriya Beema Sansthan

2. National Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

3. Nepal Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

4. Life Insurance Corporation (Nepal) Ltd.

5. Met Life ALICO (American Life Insurance Company)

6. Asian Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

7. SuryaJyoti Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

8. IME Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

9. Sun Nepal Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

10. Sanima Reliance Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

11. Reliable Nepal Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

12. Citizen Life Insurance Ltd.

13. Prabhu Mahalaxmi Life Insurance Co. Ltd.

14. Himalayan Life Insurance Ltd.

You May Also Like:

Current Status of Life Insurance Business In Nepal

Top 5 Life Insurance In Nepal

Non-life insurance is an agreement made to avoid the risk of loss of property and liability. It is generally used to insure movable and immovable property such as houses, factories, vehicles, etc.

Non-life insurance covers accidents, medical expenses, third party liability, production liability, risks involved in foreign travel. It is used to obtain compensation for damage caused by various natural calamities including accidents, fires, thefts and to get compensation or relief from possible losses due to risk.

At current, there are 14 general or non-life insurance companies in Nepal. Nepal Insurance Company is a pioneer non-lifeinsurance companyofNepalthat was established on 1947 A.D.

Below are the list of 14 general or non-life insurance companies of Nepal:

1. Nepal Insurance Co. Ltd.

2. The Oriental Insurance Co. Ltd.

3. National Insurance Co. Ltd.

4. Himalayan Everest  Insurance Insurance Co. Ltd.

5. United Ajod Insurance Ltd.

6. Siddhartha Premier Insurance Co. (Nepal) Ltd.

7. Neco Insurance Ltd.

8. Sagarmatha Lumbini Insurance Co. Ltd.

9.Prabhu Insurance Ltd.

10. Shikhar Insurance Co. Ltd.

11. NLG Insurance Ltd.

12.Rastriya Beema Co. Ltd.

13. Sanima GIC Insurance Ltd.

14. IGI Prudential Insurance Ltd.

Also Read:Top 5 Non-Life Insurance in Nepal

Since insurance companies cannot bear the entire risk of the insurance they cover, they transfer the risk from one company to another to reduce the risk, which is called reinsurance.

So far, there are 2 reinsurance companies in Nepal-Nepal Reinsurance Company and Himalayan Reinsurance Company. Nepal Reinsurance Company was established on Karthik 20, 2071 BS. Likewise, Himalayan Reinsurance Company started operation from Ashad 32, 2078 BS.

1. Nepal Reinsurance Co. Ltd.

2. Himalayan Reinsurance Ltd.

Microinsurance refers to a type of insurance specifically designed to provide coverage to low-income individuals and families who have limited access to traditional insurance products. Microinsurance can cover various areas such as health, life, property, agriculture, and more.

At present, there are 4 microinsurance companies operating in Nepal.

1. Nepal Micro Insurance Co. Ltd.

2. Guardian Micro Life Insurance Ltd.

3. Crest Micro Life Insurance Ltd.

4. Protective Micro Insurance Ltd.

news.title: 7 Micro-Insurance Companies Receive Approval For Operation
news.summary: Investopaper Nepal Insurance Authority has given pre-approval to seven micro insurance companies for operations. The authority
news.full_content:
Nepal Insurance Authority has given pre-approval to seven micro insurance companies for operations.

The authority granted permission to three micro life insurance companies and four micro non-life insurance companies on Sunday. One company was selected from each province. 31 companies had applied to the authority seeking a license to operate micro insurance companies.

1.Crest Micro-Life Insurance Ltd., (Birendranagar, Surkhet, Karnali Province)

2. Guardian Micro-Life Insurance Ltd., (Biratnagar 7, Morang, Province 1)

3. Liberty Micro-Life Insurance Ltd. (Pokhara 8 Kaski, Gandaki Province)

1. Nepal Micro Insurance Co. Ltd. (Bharatpur 1, Chitwan, Bagmati Province)

2. Protective Micro Insurance Ltd. (Kailali, Sudurpaschim Province)

3. Star Micro Insurance Company Ltd. (Janakpurdham Dhanusha, Madhesh Province)

4.Trust Micro Insurance Co.Ltd. (Butwal 2, Rupandehi, Lumbini Province)

The Authority had issued a 35-day notice on Bhadra 10 for the establishment of the company doing micro insurance business.

The company that has received the permission to operate the business must go to the company registrar’s office and register the company within 35 days.After receiving the company registration certificate, an application for a license must be submitted to the Nepal Insurance Authority.

After getting the license to operate the company, 70 percent of the paid-up capital must be deposited in the bank in the name of the company.
